Event.0: Charlemagne and his brother Carloman I are crowned Kings of The Franks
Event.1: A Taliban gunman shot 15-year-old Pakistani activist Malala Yousafzai, a vocal opponent of the ultraconservative group's prohibition on the education of girls; despite being struck in the head, she survived the assassination attempt.
Event.2: North Korea conducts its first nuclear test, with an estimated yield of between 0.4-2 kilotons
Event.3:
First Afghan presidential elections
On this day in 2004, for the first time in Afghanistan's history, voters went to the polls to choose a president, selecting Hamid Karzai, who had served as the interim president after the fall of the Taliban regime in 2001.
Event.4: The United Service Organizations (USO) appointed entertainer Wayne Newton as its official celebrity front man, replacing Bob Hope, who had served in that capacity since the early 1950s.
Event.5: Italian playwright Dario Fo was awarded the Nobel Prize for Literature.
Event.6: David H. Souter was sworn in as a U.S. Supreme Court associate justice.
Event.7: "Phantom of the Opera" premieres in London, written by Andrew Lloyd Webber and starring Michael Crawford and Sarah Brightman
Event.8: Anna Freud, psychoanalyst, author, and daughter of Sigmund Freud, died in London.
Event.9: Princess Caroline of Monaco divorces Philippe Junot
Event.10: Elvis & Priscilla Presley divorce after 6 years
Event.11:
Steve McQueen
British director, screenwriter, and artist
was born
Event.12:
PJ Harvey
British singer-songwriter and guitarist
was born
Event.13:
David Cameron
prime minister of United Kingdom
was born
Event.14:
Jackson Browne
American musician
was born
Event.15: US President Franklin D. Roosevelt approves an atomic program that would become the Manhattan Project
Event.16:
John Lennon
British musician
was born
Event.17: NY Yankees sweep Cards in 25th World Series, become 1st to sweep consecutive World Series; Babe Ruth hits 3 HRs in game
Event.19: Reds beat White Sox, 5 games to 3 in 16th World Series. This series is known as black sox scandal as 8 White Sox throw series
Event.20: Heavyweight boxing champ Jack Dempsey (21) weds Maxine Gates in Farmington, Utah
Event.21: Philanthropist John D. Rockefeller Jr (27) weds Abby Aldrich in Warwick Neck, Rhode Island
Event.22: Built between 1848 and 1884 and dedicated in 1885, the Washington Monument—a marble-faced granite obelisk that honours the first U.S. president, George Washington—opened to the public in Washington, D.C.
Event.23: Ioannis Kapodistrias, first Head of State of modern Greece, assassinated in Nafplion
Event.24: Roger Williams was banished from Massachusetts Bay Colony, and, as a result, he later founded the colony of Rhode Island.
Event.25: Mary Tudor, sister of King Henry VIII of England, became the third wife of King Louis XII of France.
Event.26: King Louis XII of France marries Mary Tudor, daughter of Henry VII (sister of Henry VIII)
Event.27: The Hangul alphabet is published in Korea
Event.28: Leif Ericson discovers "Vinland" (possibly L'Anse aux Meadows, Canada) reputedly becoming first European to reach North America
